intro: Xanthogalum purpurascens, commonly known as the red-flowered desert bean, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow to red flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep roots that help it access groundwater. Xanthogalum purpurascens plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain wildlife.
